Warehouse Assistant Job at ICS Outsourcing Limited




        
    

        
        ICS Outsourcing Limited is Nigeria’s leading Outsourcing Company and Business Support Solutions provider. We offer a comprehensive range of outsourcing services ranging from People Outsourcing to Sales BPO to all kinds and sizes of business. Value added services to our client’s has is our desire. We have a reputation for satisfying and surpassing our client’s expectations. We are one of the Top indigenous Companies in Nigeria to work for. Outsourcing in Nigeria, Outsource To Nigeria, Top Companies in Nigeria, Nigeria, outsourcing company in Nigeria, top outsourcing company in Nigeria, top, list of outsourcing company in Nigeria, outsourcing firms in Nigeria.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Assistant
Job Location: Golf, Ibeju Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Qualification: Minimum of OND in any field.
	Must be computer literate.


Salary
N78,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: abiolarichard51@gmail.com using "Warehouse Assistant" as the subject of the email.

Note: Applicant must reside within Ajah - Ibeju Lekki Axis.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Presenter / Producer",
  "description": "iBrand TV is a dynamic media station committed to delivering compelling content across broadcast, digital, and social platforms. We are currently seeking a creative, results-driven, and experienced iBrand Marketer to join our team. This role is ideal for a marketing professional with a strong background in real estate, media, event entertainment, or related industries, who is passionate about brand visibility, partnership development, and media monetization.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Presenter / Producer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ojodu Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Presenter/Producer will be responsible for hosting programs on-air while also overseeing the planning, development, and production of content.
	This role requires strong communication, creativity, and organizational skills to deliver high-quality programs that engage and captivate our audience.


Key Responsibilities


	Present live and pre-recorded programs with professionalism, confidence, and audience engagement.
	Research, plan, and produce compelling content for programs.
	Develop scripts, show outlines, and program flow.
	Conduct interviews with guests, experts, and contributors.
	Collaborate with production, technical, and editorial teams to ensure smooth delivery of programs.
	Edit and review content to maintain quality and relevance.
	Stay up to date with current events, trends, and audience interests to keep content fresh and engaging.
	Ensure programs align with the station&rsquo;s vision, brand, and broadcasting standards.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Mass Communication, Media Studies, Journalism, or related field.
	2 - 5 relevant years of work experience.
	Proven experience as a presenter and / or producer in a media or broadcasting environment.
	Excellent verbal communication, presentation, and interviewing skills.
	Strong creative and storytelling abilities.
	Ability to multitask, work under pressure, and meet deadlines.
	Proficiency in content production tools and basic editing skills (audio/video) is an added advantage.
	A confident, engaging personality with the ability to connect with diverse audiences.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@pallyagro.ng&nbsp;using &ldquo;Application &ndash; Presenter / Producer&rdquo;&nbsp;as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-10",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-25",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "iBrandtv"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "187181"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

}



Presenter / Producer Job at iBrand TV




        
    

        
        iBrand TV is a dynamic media station committed to delivering compelling content across broadcast, digital, and social platforms. We are currently seeking a creative, results-driven, and experienced iBrand Marketer to join our team. This role is ideal for a marketing professional with a strong background in real estate, media, event entertainment, or related industries, who is passionate about brand visibility, partnership development, and media monetization.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Presenter / Producer

Job Location: Ojodu Berger, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Presenter/Producer will be responsible for hosting programs on-air while also overseeing the planning, development, and production of content.
	This role requires strong communication, creativity, and organizational skills to deliver high-quality programs that engage and captivate our audience.


Key Responsibilities


	Present live and pre-recorded programs with professionalism, confidence, and audience engagement.
	Research, plan, and produce compelling content for programs.
	Develop scripts, show outlines, and program flow.
	Conduct interviews with guests, experts, and contributors.
	Collaborate with production, technical, and editorial teams to ensure smooth delivery of programs.
	Edit and review content to maintain quality and relevance.
	Stay up to date with current events, trends, and audience interests to keep content fresh and engaging.
	Ensure programs align with the station’s vision, brand, and broadcasting standards.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Mass Communication, Media Studies, Journalism, or related field.
	2 - 5 relevant years of work experience.
	Proven experience as a presenter and / or producer in a media or broadcasting environment.
	Excellent verbal communication, presentation, and interviewing skills.
	Strong creative and storytelling abilities.
	Ability to multitask, work under pressure, and meet deadlines.
	Proficiency in content production tools and basic editing skills (audio/video) is an added advantage.
	A confident, engaging personality with the ability to connect with diverse audiences.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@pallyagro.ng using “Application – Presenter / Producer” as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Backend Engineer (Java)",
  "description": "SwiftLink Global Services Limited is a provider of payment solutions services, licensed by the Central Bank of Nigeria. We specialise in secure end-to-end payment solutions, connecting and empowering individuals, businesses, and communities across Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Backend Engineer (Java)
Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job&nbsp;Description


	We are seeking a Backend Engineer with deep expertise in Java (Spring Boot) and hands-on experience in building secure, highly available fintech payment systems.
	This role is ideal for an engineer who thrives in transaction-heavy environments and is eager to contribute to Swiftlink&rsquo;s mission of delivering merchant-focused payment solutions across Nigeria.


Role &amp; Responsibilities
The individual in this role will:


	Design and develop Swiftlink&rsquo;s core payment processing engine, ensuring scalability and resilience.
	Implement transaction routing, settlement, and reconciliation for cards, transfers, and wallets.
	Integrate with banks, processors, and card schemes (ISO8583, APIs).
	Work with CloudHSM and Vault to implement secure key management practices.
	Build and maintain microservices architecture leveraging Kubernetes and Kafka.
	Collaborate with Compliance and Operations teams to ensure PCI DSS-ready implementations.
	Apply best practices in secure coding, scalability, and availability for mission-critical services.
	Support technical documentation and knowledge-sharing within engineering teams.


Desired Qualifications and Experience


	Minimum of 4 years experience in backend engineering.
	Strong knowledge of Java/Kotlin (Spring Boot).
	Proven experience in payment systems (ISO8583, card processing, settlement, reconciliation).
	Proficiency with PostgreSQL, Redis, Kafka.
	Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and static code analysis (SonarQube, CodeQL).
	Understanding of PCI DSS standards and secure software development practices.


Skills and Attitude:


	Security-first mindset with strong attention to detail.
	Problem solver with capacity to design for high-volume, high-reliability systems.
	Collaborative, working well in cross-functional fintech teams.
	Adaptable and growth-driven, comfortable in a fast-paced, evolving environment.


Why Join Us?


	Work on mission-critical fintech systems shaping the future of digital payments in Africa.
	Gain hands-on experience with scalable transaction infrastructure and compliance frameworks.
	Be part of a collaborative, innovation-driven culture with strong learning opportunities.
	Enjoy attractive compensation, health insurance, and pension benefits.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;hr@swiftlink.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Backend Engineer (Java) Job at SwiftLink Global Services Limited




        
    

        
        SwiftLink Global Services Limited is a provider of payment solutions services, licensed by the Central Bank of Nigeria. We specialise in secure end-to-end payment solutions, connecting and empowering individuals, businesses, and communities across Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Backend Engineer (Java)
Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a Backend Engineer with deep expertise in Java (Spring Boot) and hands-on experience in building secure, highly available fintech payment systems.
	This role is ideal for an engineer who thrives in transaction-heavy environments and is eager to contribute to Swiftlink’s mission of delivering merchant-focused payment solutions across Nigeria.


Role & Responsibilities
The individual in this role will:


	Design and develop Swiftlink’s core payment processing engine, ensuring scalability and resilience.
	Implement transaction routing, settlement, and reconciliation for cards, transfers, and wallets.
	Integrate with banks, processors, and card schemes (ISO8583, APIs).
	Work with CloudHSM and Vault to implement secure key management practices.
	Build and maintain microservices architecture leveraging Kubernetes and Kafka.
	Collaborate with Compliance and Operations teams to ensure PCI DSS-ready implementations.
	Apply best practices in secure coding, scalability, and availability for mission-critical services.
	Support technical documentation and knowledge-sharing within engineering teams.


Desired Qualifications and Experience


	Minimum of 4 years experience in backend engineering.
	Strong knowledge of Java/Kotlin (Spring Boot).
	Proven experience in payment systems (ISO8583, card processing, settlement, reconciliation).
	Proficiency with PostgreSQL, Redis, Kafka.
	Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and static code analysis (SonarQube, CodeQL).
	Understanding of PCI DSS standards and secure software development practices.


Skills and Attitude:


	Security-first mindset with strong attention to detail.
	Problem solver with capacity to design for high-volume, high-reliability systems.
	Collaborative, working well in cross-functional fintech teams.
	Adaptable and growth-driven, comfortable in a fast-paced, evolving environment.


Why Join Us?


	Work on mission-critical fintech systems shaping the future of digital payments in Africa.
	Gain hands-on experience with scalable transaction infrastructure and compliance frameworks.
	Be part of a collaborative, innovation-driven culture with strong learning opportunities.
	Enjoy attractive compensation, health insurance, and pension benefits.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: hr@swiftlink.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Immigration Paralegal",
  "description": "Tailored Talent -&nbsp;Our client in the Visa advisory space is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Immigration Paralegal

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	Our client is seeking a high agency, fast learning lawyer who is interested in the US immigration law.
	The ideal candidate will demonstrate excellent communication and interpersonal skills, strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, and meticulous attention to detail.


Key Responsibilities
Legal Research &amp; Case Preparation:


	Conduct detailed research on U.S. immigration laws, regulations, and policies.
	Prepare and draft petitions, applications, and supporting documentation for O1, EB1, and EB2-NIW visas.


Client Intake &amp; Management:


	Conduct initial client intake sessions to gather critical information for case evaluation.
	Manage client relationships by maintaining clear, consistent communication throughout the visa process.
	Address client inquiries and provide timely updates on case progress.


Drafting &amp; Documentation:


	Draft compelling cover letters and legal arguments to support visa applications.
	Ensure the accuracy and completeness of all case-related documents.
	Work closely with attorneys to review and finalize case filings.


Collaboration &amp; Coordination:


	Coordinate with attorneys to manage case strategy and timelines.
	Liaise with clients, attorneys, and external stakeholders to gather necessary evidence and materials.
	Maintain meticulous case records using digital case management systems.


Process Improvement &amp; Compliance:


	Identify opportunities to improve internal processes for efficiency and accuracy.
	Ensure compliance with U.S. immigration laws and ethical standards.


Qualifications


	Education: LL.B from a reputable University.
	Experience: Minimum 3-5 years of post-Bar experience.
	Expertise: In managing clients and having a deep understanding of immigration law, including drafting cover letters and petitions.
	Skills: Strong writing and research skills, with the ability to craft compelling arguments. High attention to detail and accuracy in reviewing case materials. Strong ability to conduct both legal and general research efficiently.
	Tech-Savvy: Proficiency with case management software and remote collaboration tools.
	Client-focused: Exceptional interpersonal skills for client intake, relationship management, and case coordination.


Salary
N400,000 - N550,000 / month.&nbsp;",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-09",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "name": "TailoredTalent"
    
  },

Immigration Paralegal Job at Tailored Talent




        
    

        
        Tailored Talent - Our client in the Visa advisory space is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Immigration Paralegal

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	Our client is seeking a high agency, fast learning lawyer who is interested in the US immigration law.
	The ideal candidate will demonstrate excellent communication and interpersonal skills, strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, and meticulous attention to detail.


Key Responsibilities
Legal Research & Case Preparation:
     

            
    




	Conduct detailed research on U.S. immigration laws, regulations, and policies.
	Prepare and draft petitions, applications, and supporting documentation for O1, EB1, and EB2-NIW visas.


Client Intake & Management:


	Conduct initial client intake sessions to gather critical information for case evaluation.
	Manage client relationships by maintaining clear, consistent communication throughout the visa process.
	Address client inquiries and provide timely updates on case progress.


Drafting & Documentation:


	Draft compelling cover letters and legal arguments to support visa applications.
	Ensure the accuracy and completeness of all case-related documents.
	Work closely with attorneys to review and finalize case filings.


Collaboration & Coordination:


	Coordinate with attorneys to manage case strategy and timelines.
	Liaise with clients, attorneys, and external stakeholders to gather necessary evidence and materials.
	Maintain meticulous case records using digital case management systems.


Process Improvement & Compliance:


	Identify opportunities to improve internal processes for efficiency and accuracy.
	Ensure compliance with U.S. immigration laws and ethical standards.


Qualifications


	Education: LL.B from a reputable University.
	Experience: Minimum 3-5 years of post-Bar experience.
	Expertise: In managing clients and having a deep understanding of immigration law, including drafting cover letters and petitions.
	Skills: Strong writing and research skills, with the ability to craft compelling arguments. High attention to detail and accuracy in reviewing case materials. Strong ability to conduct both legal and general research efficiently.
	Tech-Savvy: Proficiency with case management software and remote collaboration tools.
	Client-focused: Exceptional interpersonal skills for client intake, relationship management, and case coordination.


Salary
N400,000 - N550,000 / month.     

    

        Click here to Apply
